result.execSummary:
The defendant Colton J Chase was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sexual Assault of Child by Person Who Works or Volunteers with Children, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.095(3)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent - Sexual offender evaluation and treatment
DNA sample
Not eligible for expungement - May revisit expungment if this conviction allows by law

timeConds.notes: with huber - To commence on or before 3/4/16 9:00am - Court would allow a later start date if agreed upon by Probation Agent and Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant Colton J Chase in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statements by Dunphy - Arguments by Dunphy/Laufenberg/Defendant/Court to sentencing - Sentence withheld -  36 months probation - 8 months jail with huber - To commence on or before 9:00am 3/4/16 -(Court would allow a later start date is agreed upon by Agent and Defendant -   No contact with victim EMV- Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent - Sexual offender evaluation and treatment - Court finds defendant is not eligible for expungement - May revisit expungment if this conviction allows by law -  Fine $250 plus costs/Surcharges - Credit for 8 days jail - Post conviction rights given

records.addlTxt: Defendant Colton J Chase in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea no contest to count 1 - Counts 2&3 DRI - Waiver of rights and tendering plea - Waiver free and voluntary - Factual basis exists for plea - Found guilty by court - Bond continued  Scheduling conference scheduled for November 12, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Colton J Chase in court, in custody with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called 9:04am - Preliminary hearing waived - Court finds waiver free and voluntary - Court finds probable cause that a felony had been committed and binds defendant over for further proceedings - Information filed with court - In receipt - Waive reading - Plea not guilty - Arguments by Laufenberg regarding bail - Copies of letters in favor of Mr. Chase have been provided to DA - Court will modify bail - $10,000 over all - $1500 cash balance sig bond -  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 10:55 am.

Defendant Colton J Chase in court, in custody with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Laufenberg retained - Will be represented - The preliminary hearing is adjourned - Argument by Laufenberg regarding bail modification - Response by Dunphy - Court will not modify bond at this time - Statements by Laufenberg - Bond continued  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.
No unsupervised contact with children under 18 years old - Not to volunteer with any activities that involve children under the age of 18

Defendant Colton J Chase in court, in custody with attorney Gavin Grubofski.  Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Grubofski appears specially - In receipt of complaint - Waive reading - Dunphy to bail, requests cash - Response by Grubofski - Court sets $2500 cash  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
